Posts.Content: JanetinVirginia wrote: I'm trying to read through forums like mad to soak up information, but I'm getting lost trying to translate all the abbreviations.  It's like learning another language.  I figured out BS means breast surgeon.  What is PS, LE and all various abbreviations using x?  Can someone direct me to maybe another post out there with a list of the most basic translations so I know what I'm reading?  Thanks. Dx 9/1/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Getting lost in abbreviations JanetinVirginia nancyh

Posts.Content: JanetinVirginia wrote: Mastectomy coming up next week & getting anxious about everything, including the isotope/ blue dye procedure for sentinel node biopsy.  In my opinion, an injection right through the nipple sounds like it would have been a good Medieval torture method.  I have read in various places in the forum that some women have lidocaine  injections because the injections of isotope/dye are very painful.  Others say they were "out" before the procedure started.  When I asked during my pre-op nurse interview today, she said I would be given a nipple patch the day before to wear for 10 hours - haven't heard that one. Isn't there any standard of care out there????   If anyone has had the nipple lidocaine patch, does it WORK?  Dx 9/1/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Does lidocaine nipple patch work before SNB? JanetinVirginia Sassa
